skill.name: code-reviewer
skill.description: Automated code review with security scanning, quality metrics, and best practices analysis. Use when reviewing code for: (1) Security vulnerabilities and common attack vectors, (2) Code quality issues and maintainability concerns, (3) Performance bottlenecks and optimization opportunities, (4) Best practices and design patterns, (5) Test coverage and testing strategies, (6) Documentation quality and completeness
skill.summary: Automated code review with security scanning, quality metrics, and best practices analysis. Use when...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This skill consists of documentation and a Python helper script that runs legitimate security analysis tools (bandit, radon, pylint, safety). The script only accesses user-specified file paths and its subprocess calls to external tools directly match its code review purpose. No malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Review code for security and quality
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews miss critical issues. This skill provides systematic workflows to identify security vulnerabilities, code quality problems, performance bottlenecks, and testing gaps. Use the automated helper script to scan code and receive actionable findings.
actual_capabilities: Run security scans with Bandit to find vulnerabilities
Analyze code complexity using Radon metrics
Check dependencies for known vulnerabilities with Safety
Generate comprehensive review reports in Markdown or JSON
limitations: Only scans code when helper script is installed and run separately
Does not automatically integrate with version control systems
Limited to languages supported by underlying tools (Python primary)

use_cases.title: Security audit prep
use_cases.description: Prepare for security audits by scanning code for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and common attack patterns.

use_cases.title: PR review process
use_cases.description: Standardize pull request reviews with checklists covering security, quality, performance, and testing criteria.

use_cases.title: Learn code review
use_cases.description: Learn effective code review practices through structured guidance and concrete examples of issues to find.

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the code at {file_path} for security vulnerabilities. Use the security review workflow from the code-reviewer skill.

prompt_templates.title: Full code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete code review of the code at {directory_path}. Follow the 6-phase review workflow: initial analysis, security review, code quality analysis, performance review, testing assessment, and documentation review.

prompt_templates.title: Quality audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the code quality of {file_path}. Check complexity metrics, naming conventions, error handling, and adherence to best practices. Generate a quality report.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the dependencies in {project_path} for known security vulnerabilities using the safety tool. List any vulnerable packages found.

output_examples.input: Review the authentication module for security issues
output: ‚Ä¢ Line 42: Potential SQL injection - use parameterized queries

best_practices: Run automated scans first, then focus human review on logic and design
Prioritize security and correctness over code style preferences
Use the checklist systematically to ensure consistent coverage
Provide constructive feedback that explains the why behind suggestions
anti_patterns: Bikeshedding over trivial style issues instead of substantive problems
Skipping security review for small or urgent changes
Ignoring automated tool output without investigation
Focusing only on syntax without examining business logic

faq.question: Which languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Primary support for Python with guidance for JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, and Go. The helper script focuses on Python tools.

faq.question: What security tools are used?
faq.answer: Bandit for Python security scanning, Safety for dependency vulnerabilities, Radon for complexity, and Pylint for quality.

faq.question: How do I install the helper script?
faq.answer: Run: pip install radon bandit safety pylint. Then use: python scripts/review_helper.py --file path/to/code --report full.

faq.question: Is my code sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill runs locally on your machine. No data is transmitted to external servers.

faq.question: What if tools are not installed?
faq.answer: The script gracefully handles missing tools with warnings. Install them for full functionality or use the manual review workflow.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Copilot?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured review workflows. Use it alongside AI coding assistants for comprehensive code quality assurance.
